This was the case on 1.0 and 1.0.1 as well, I'm using Windows 7 64-bit on Steam. I have to assume this is my install because it seems either no one else is experiencing this, or worse, it's working as intended. When using the chase camera, what you would naturally expect it to do is chase your craft, however, when I switch to it, it always just selects some arbitrary point around my craft. The expected behavior here is that it would focus behind the craft, or at least in the direction your craft is moving. You are still free to move it around and it will lock wherever you point it and follow that angle instead, which is fine, but what is the point if I have to center it myself?

ASUS G550JK

Core i7-4710HQ @ 2.50GHz

8GB DDR3 @ 800Mhz

nVidia GeForce GTX 850M w/ 2GB DDR5 @ 1000Mhz
Agreed, switching to chase cam should initially position the camera somewhere behind and probably slightly off axis ("above" for an aircraft, for example).

I'm finding the chase cam to not even be oriented correctly, after re-positioning it behind the craft. In 0.90 you could use it so you could know which way to steer, particularly when docking. Now it seems to be completely off, making things a lot harder.

Just use Improved chase cam. (google KSP improved chase cam)

It works a lot better.
Also, the chase camera from previous versions has been renamed to LOCKED. That sounds like it may be the problem.
